snippet: There is a growing willingness by Afghan officials, from the president’s office down through the ministries, to publicly counter what they see as American arrogance.
abstract: News analysis; Afghan officials are showing growing willingness to publicly counter what they see as American arrogance as United States attempts to withdraw troops from country; even officials who openly want Americans to stay are now saying that their continued presence must be strictly on Afghan terms.

byline.contributor: Sharifullah Sahak contributed reporting from Kabul, and Thom Shanker from Washington.

lead_paragraph: There is a growing willingness by Afghan officials, from the president’s office down through the ministries, to publicly counter what they see as American arrogance.

headline.main: Rifts Over Fees and Taliban Sour Afghanistan Exit
headline.print_headline: Rifts Over Fees and Taliban Sour Afghanistan Exit

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
